-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
#Primary Productivity
```{r}
# Load the necessary libraries
library(ncdf4)
library(raster)
library(terra)

# Open the NetCDF file
nc_file <- nc_open("Data/phyc_baseline_2000_2020_depthmean_7d39_02af_cdbd_U1721256162328.nc")

# Print the details of the variables and dimensions
print(nc_file)

# Define latitude and longitude constraints
latitude_range <- c(-89.975, 89.975)
longitude_range <- c(-179.975, 179.975)

# Get the latitude and longitude values from the NetCDF file
latitudes <- ncvar_get(nc_file, "latitude") # Replace with the actual latitude variable name in your file
longitudes <- ncvar_get(nc_file, "longitude") # Replace with the actual longitude variable name in your file

# Find the indices that match the desired latitude and longitude ranges
lat_idx <- which(latitudes >= latitude_range[1] & latitudes <= latitude_range[2])
lon_idx <- which(longitudes >= longitude_range[1] & longitudes <= longitude_range[2])

# Select the specific variable (replace 'phyc_mean' with your variable of interest)
variable_name <- "phyc_mean"

# Close the NetCDF file
nc_close(nc_file)

# Reverse the latitude indices to fix the upside-down issue
variable_data <- variable_data[, rev(seq_len(ncol(variable_data)))]

# Create a raster object from the variable data
r <- raster(t(variable_data)) # Transpose the matrix to switch latitude and longitude

# Assign the latitude and longitude values to the raster object
extent(r) <- extent(min(longitudes[lon_idx]), max(longitudes[lon_idx]), min(latitudes[lat_idx]), max(latitudes[lat_idx]))

# Convert the raster object to a SpatRaster object
primary_productivity <- rast(r)
```

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
#Reading in Manta Data + doing some changes

```{r}
#reading the manta data (model data)
manta_data <- st_read("Data/model_data.csv")
```

```{r}
#removing the c() around the coordinates
manta_data <- manta_data %>%
  mutate(
    geometry = str_replace(geometry, "c\\(", "") %>%
      str_replace_all("\\)", ""),
    geometry2 = str_replace(geometry2, "c\\(", "") %>%
      str_replace_all("\\)", "")
  )
```

```{r}
manta_data <- manta_data %>%
  rename(
    longitude = geometry,
    latitude = geometry2
  )
```

```{r}
manta_data_sf <- st_as_sf(manta_data, coords = c("longitude", "latitude"), crs = "EPSG:4326") 
```

```{r}
coords <- st_coordinates(manta_data_sf)

# Add longitude and latitude to the data frame
manta_data_sf <- manta_data_sf %>%
  mutate(
    longitude = coords[, 1],
    latitude = coords[, 2]
  )

# Print the updated data frame
print(manta_data_sf)
```
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
#Mean temperature

```{r}
#setting the max ocean temp crs to be the same
mean_temp <- terra::project(mean_ocean_temp,
                                 crs(manta_data_sf))
terra::crop(mean_ocean_temp, manta_data_sf)
temp = terra::extract(x = mean_ocean_temp,y = manta_data_sf)
```
```{r}
# selecting just the 2010 - 2019 column and renaming it to mean_temp 
temp_final <- temp %>%
  dplyr::select("thetao_mean_2") %>% 
  rename("mean_temp" = "thetao_mean_2")
```

#Primary Productivity

